annotation.spannedText: Vaccines against diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough and polio were the first to have a major impact on disease burden globally

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines against diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough and polio were the first to have a major impact on disease burden globally

annotation.spannedText: as more vaccines are developed, the challenge of delivering them with minimal pain, anxiety and number of visits to the doctor has increased

classMention.mentionClass: as more vaccines are developed, the challenge of delivering them with minimal pain, anxiety and number of visits to the doctor has increased

annotation.spannedText: Improving the experience of vaccination will almost certainly have a positive impact on vaccination programs

classMention.mentionClass: Improving the experience of vaccination will almost certainly have a positive impact on vaccination programs

annotation.spannedText: Needleless devices will also reduce the risk of needle-stick injuries to health-care workers

classMention.mentionClass: Needleless devices will also reduce the risk of needle-stick injuries to health-care workers

annotation.spannedText: the choice of needles versus needle-free vaccines must also be guided by other considerations

classMention.mentionClass: the choice of needles versus needle-free vaccines must also be guided by other considerations

annotation.spannedText: needle-free vaccines must be as good or better at preventing disease

classMention.mentionClass: needle-free vaccines must be as good or better at preventing disease

annotation.spannedText: These must all be considered and weighed up to ensure maximal individual and public health benefit of vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: These must all be considered and weighed up to ensure maximal individual and public health benefit of vaccines

annotation.spannedText: As newer vaccines become available and disease prevention targets increase, needle-free technology will become increasingly attractive

classMention.mentionClass: As newer vaccines become available and disease prevention targets increase, needle-free technology will become increasingly attractive
